result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan P. Kroha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan P. Kroha is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan P. Kroha was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA Sample
Concurrent with: Current sentence being served in Kettle Moraine

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan P. Kroha

records.addlTxt: Per ADA Pfeifer there is no objection to the return of property requested by Mr. Kroha. The hearing scheduled for 5/27/2020 will be removed from the calendar.
and motion for withdrawal of counsel -
Letter from Defendant re: seized property

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
2:33 p.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennet states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. State moves to dismiss count 1 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 2 to Receipt of Stolen Property contrary to 943.34, a Misdemeanor - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bennett statement that restitution has not been requested - requests any restitution information be filed within 30 days. Pfeifer/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Jail - 6 months CC with current sentence being served in Kettle Moraine
CC/DNA Surcharge-remitted
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Appeal rights given. 
Adj. 2:46 p.m.

3:48 p.m. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court via telephone with leave of court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett statement - believes resolution has been reached - needs client's input. Requests additional date. Bail continued. Adj. 3:49 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:18 p.m. Attorney Brian F. Bennett in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett states that defendant is in prison; offer has been made; would like additional time to discuss with client. Bail continued. Adj. 2:20 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
State's continued reply to discovery demand

3:32 p.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody appearing telephonically with leave of court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett - In receipt of Information, waive further reading, enter pleas of not guilty. Bail continued. Telephone appearance for defendant is approved if no resolution by next court hearing - Counsel to notify JA prior to court hearing if telephone appearance or in person appearance is needed. 3:34 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Ryan Kroha will be appearing by phone from prison on 4/25 - 920-324-5577 extension 6394

3:27 p.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bennett requests telephone or video appearance by defendant at arraignment as he may be transferred to another DOC facility. Arrangements to be made in advance for defendant's appearance by telephone at next hearing. Adj. 3:29 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:42 p.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court via video with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:44 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Note from Jail - defendant refused to sign bond
No contact with victim Rose Ramsey

1:43 p.m. Defendant Ryan P. Kroha in court, via video in custody.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:45 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
